Pore/Structural Features.Pore Size: 1.1 nm (channel diameter, after accounting for van der Waals radii)

Guest Molecules.Mechanism: Quantum sieving due to zero-point energy difference

Other Information.Additional Info: Selectivity over hydrogen increases with decreasing temperature.

Guest Molecules.Mechanism: Quantum sieving due to zero-point energy difference

Other Information.Additional Info: Lower selectivity compared to deuterium at low temperatures.

Sieving Mechanism: Size exclusion at sub-nanometer scale combined with quantum effects

Experimental Validation.Method: Gas adsorption isotherms and Idealized Adsorption Solution Theory (IAST)
Experimental Validation.Performance Metrics: D2/H2 selectivity: ~5 at 77 K in the low-pressure limit; D2/H2 selectivity exceeds 2 at 1 atm and 77 K

Other Information.Additional Info: The material exhibits enhanced selectivity due to higher translational zero-point energy of H2 compared to D2.

Pore/Structural Features.Pore Size: 1.1 nm (channel diameter, after accounting for van der Waals radii)

Guest Molecules.Mechanism: Quantum sieving due to zero-point energy difference

Other Information.Additional Info: Higher selectivity compared to hydrogen at low temperatures.

Guest Molecules.Mechanism: Quantum sieving due to zero-point energy difference

Other Information.Additional Info: Lower selectivity compared to deuterium at low temperatures.

Sieving Mechanism: Size exclusion at sub-nanometer scale combined with quantum effects

Experimental Validation.Method: Gas adsorption isotherms and Idealized Adsorption Solution Theory (IAST)
Experimental Validation.Performance Metrics: D2/H2 selectivity: ~1.3–1.5 at 77 K in the low-pressure limit

Other Information.Additional Info: The material exhibits moderate selectivity due to differences in zero-point energies between H2 and D2.
